result.execSummary:
The defendant Petra E Urena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Petra E Urena is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Petra E Urena was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Petra E Urena

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements

1:09 pm
Defendant Petra E Urena in court, along with Father.
Court questions Defendant about ability to pay.  Defendant asks Court to address Father as he will be making the payments.
Court addresses Defendant's Father.  Defendant's Father offers to pay $200 per paycheck.  
Court orders payment in the amount of $100 bi-weekly, beginning Friday, October 7, 2016, and continuing every other Friday, until paid in full.  Court informs Defendant and Father additional monies can be paid but are not required.
Court authorizes Warrant - stayed pending compliance with payment arrangements.
Court adjourned at 1:11 pm

9:11 a.m .  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to count 1, will recommend a fine and costs, DNA sample and AODA and count 2 will be dismissed.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Statement by defendant.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan even if it is very minimal.  Court will allow some of the fine to be converted community service.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.

*Complete Processing.

Court adjourned at 9:19 a.m.
